text:
Hey! Sorry, been a bit awol!
Are you thinking of building a procedural building and destroying it, or two seperate ideas: a rbd sim and a procedural building?

Procedural modelling will always be useful, no matter what. A few people at work at this current moment are looking into procedural modelling; seeing how many variations of a building or design we can get with minimal effort

So I would agree, if you want to have a personal project, a procedural modelling project is not a bad place to start.
Have you seen any references or ideas you'd like to try?
